reviews.text: An excellent site of power and travel infrastructure intersecting with the artificially constructed concept of nature. Love to see the cooling towers towering over me as I wait for my train, I had a call with my comrade in the meantime, and it was very tranquil. Can't wait for this combo of power, rail and nature to be fundamental to an ecologically sound society!

'East Midlands Parkway' is 5miles (!) from 'East Midlands Airport' in the middle of nowhere. Phantom station. Idiotic, pointless and, most importantly, misleading. 15 quid for a taxi ride from airport to station, too. Will never use again.

Not a bad little station but let down terribly by "gourmet" cafe bar. Most miserable rude unapologetic people....they really shouldn't be in the hospitality business. Had run out of baguettes for breakfast sandwiches by 8.15 and had ketchup but no brown sauce for those who manages to get a baguette! People are here because they have to travel. Chances are they're busy and are grabbing food/coffee because they have a minute. Certainly not because of the charm offensive, value for money, taste or level of service.

Huge thanks to the man at the ticket desk for helping me this morning after missing my train by 2 mins because of the A42 closure. As I was travelling to catch a flight I was very worried about what to do. He was very kind and restored my faith in humanity a bit!

It’s a very small train station and has all (well, most of) the basic facilities (toilets and baby changing area, a small cafe, staffed ticket office, indoor seating area, free ATM machine, and even a basic first class lounge). But, and here is a big BUT, they fail to provide any drinking water facilities. How cheap and easy would be to install a simple water fountain? And it could help people not have to buy single use plastic bottles. As a regular commuter I made several enquiries about this and still no response. I hope they improve soon.
